This is by design in JUnit:  your test =
objects are reinstantiated from
scratch before every test method, which mak=
es it hard to maintain state
between method invocations.

Another problem i=
s that JUnit test methods can't accept parameters, and I
suspect that it's =
really what you are trying to achieve (passing these
parameters in the cons=
tructor is the usual way to work around this
limitation).

Since these are =
two design decisions I didn't like in JUnit, I implemented
them differently=
 in TestNG, which:

- Doesn't reinstantiate your test object between each t=
est invocation
- Lets you pass parameters to test methods (and you specify =
the values for
these parameters either in XML or programmatically)
